jobs.title: Technical Program Manager
jobs.description:
Company Description
At Hyperscience we develop and deliver intelligent solutions to automate manual document processing for global financial services, insurance, healthcare, and government organizations. Founded in 2014, our solution extracts handwritten, cursive and printed typed text at better-than-human levels of accuracy and automation that get better over time. By streamlining operations and reducing the costs associated with data entry, we enable some of the world’s largest companies to improve customer service and drive new business opportunities.

With more than $50 million raised to date, we’re growing quickly and looking for individuals to join our team and make a difference in our organization and for our customers.

Job Description
As a Technical Program Manager, you will lead a number of high-impact, cross-functional initiatives across the organization working with Product Management, Engineering, Product Marketing, Customer Experience, and Sales. This is a critical role that will span different responsibilities from managing and improving various aspects of our product development program to creating scalable processes for distilling product feedback and insights from the field to leading key initiatives for disseminating the right amount of product information across different parts of the organization. You will be expected to quickly build strong relationships with key stakeholders from different departments, execute multiple programs at the same time, and establish the right processes to not only drive continuous improvement across multiple teams, but also coach others in building and maintaining scalable and measurable processes.

This is an exciting time for Hyperscience’s product and business. You will have the opportunity to influence and deliver on a bold vision for transforming the way organizations model and execute their business processes, and there will be many opportunities for growth along the way.


Responsibilities
- Drive initiatives across Engineering, Product, Customer Experience to continuously improve the quality and reliability of our product.
- Develop processes for maintaining the efficiency and transparency of our product development process as we significantly scale our team and product.
- Become an expert on the product and work cross-functionally to identify gaps and drive initiatives to disseminate the right amount of product knowledge to different parts of the organization.
- Develop efficient processes for gathering and distilling product feedback and insights from the field as our teams grow.
- Develop and keep track of program KPIs and communicate those to relevant parts of the organization.


Qualifications
- 4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, or technical program / product management experience at a technology company.
- Experience in technical program or project management.
- Experience working autonomously, leading cross-functional teams distributed across multiple time zones.
- Demonstrated ability to gather requirements from multiple sources and build a compelling project plan.
- Natural leadership skills and ability to work with all teams in the company and external partners.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


Nice-to-haves
- CSM certification or Agile experience
- Experience in enterprise software development.


Benefits & Perks
- Top notch healthcare for you and your family
- 30 days of paid leave annually to help nurture work-life symbiosis
- A 100% 401(k) match for up to 6% of your annual salary
- Stock Options
- Paid gym membership
- Pre-tax transportation and commuter benefits
- 6 month parental leave (or double salary to pay for your partner's unpaid leave)
- Free travel for any person accompanying a breastfeeding mother and her baby on a business trip
- A child care and education stipend up to $3,000 per month, per child, under the age of 21 for a maximum of $6,000 per month total
- Daily catered lunch, snacks, and drinks
- Budget to attend conferences, train, and further your education
- Relocation assistance


HyperScience provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HyperScience complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Technical Writer
jobs.description:
Company Description
At Hyperscience we develop and deliver intelligent solutions to automate manual document processing for global financial services, insurance, healthcare, and government organizations. Founded in 2014, our solution extracts handwritten, cursive and printed typed text at better-than-human levels of accuracy and automation that get better over time. By streamlining operations and reducing the costs associated with data entry, we enable some of the world’s largest companies to improve customer service and drive new business opportunities.

With more than $50 million raised to date, we’re growing quickly and looking for individuals to join our team and make a difference in our organization and for our customers.

Job Description
The Technical Writer plays a critical role in enabling our internal teams and our customers through clear, organized, and extensive documentation. In this role, you will gain a deep understanding of Hyperscience’s state-of-the-art AI solutions, work across multiple teams, and lead projects for developing content that not only increases the quality of our product offering but also helps make our internal teams more efficient. This role will give you the opportunity to grow and lead continuously more complex and high-impact projects.


Responsibilities
- Develop an understanding of our solutions and customer workflows and use cases.
- Plan, develop, and launch high-quality product documentation with our end users in mind.
- Work closely with Product Management, Product Marketing, Engineering, and our go-to-market teams to develop internal and external training resources. These include materials such as user guides, release notes, and content based on product support questions.
- Assist in initiatives related to coaching other teams in generating written content useful across the organization.
- Continuously seek opportunities and innovative solutions for improving internal documentation and related processes with the goal of making them more actionable and efficient.


Qualifications
- Bachelor’s Degree from a top-tier institution
- 2+ years of experience in technical writing
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Has a "get things done" attitude even when projects are new and in uncharted territory
- Strong product instincts with a desire to understand our products and customers deeply
- Superior attention to detail, organizational skills, and multitasking abilities
- Familiarity with software engineering concepts


The Nice-to-Have's
- Software development or systems engineering experience


Benefits & Perks
- Top notch healthcare for you and your family 
- 30 days of paid leave annually to help nurture work-life symbiosis 
- A 100% 401(k) match for up to 6% of your annual salary 
- Stock Options 
- Paid gym membership 
- Pre-tax transportation and commuter benefits 
- 6 month parental leave (or double salary to pay for your partner's unpaid leave) 
- Free travel for any person accompanying a breastfeeding mother and her baby on a business trip 
- A child care and education stipend up to $3,000 per month, per child, under the age of 21 for a maximum of $6,000 per month total 
- Daily catered lunch, snacks, and drinks 
- Budget to attend conferences, train, and further your education 
- Relocation assistance


We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
